# How to Use Email Marketing For Travel Agency

Written by: **Chris Donald**

Chris is Managing Partner at InboxArmy and has more than 25 years of
experience in email marketing

Table of Contents

  * Email Marketing For Travel Agencies
  * Why Is Email Marketing Important In The Travel Industry?

  * 20 Travel Email Subject Lines That You Can Use

Travel marketing is all about reaching the right prospect at the right time.
As the window for holiday plans and vacation intent can be short-lived, it is
vital to capture the attention of potential customers right away. Email
marketing for tourism or travel businesses has a unique set of challenges. But
if done properly, it can be a powerful customer engagement and acquisition
tool.

This blog looks at the critical considerations for travel email marketing and
provides tips for optimizing your efforts.

## Email Marketing For Travel Agencies

There is no denying that the essence of travel and hospitality is in the
experience of the stay. But that is only possible if you can get a customer to
book. The right marketing strategy has the power to put travellers in the
shoes of an experience before they commit.

High-quality visuals, stories, and customer reviews can paint a picture of the
experience that awaits. Email marketing is often a key element of this
strategy.

Travel email campaigns are targeted, creative and personal. They give email
marketers the ability to think beyond conventional promotions and build
relationships with potential customers.

However, peak campaign performance is only possible if you understand every
customer’s context and user journey. For instance, about 69% of all travel
emails today are read on mobile devices. So, creating a mobile-friendly
experience is of utmost importance.

## **Why Is Email Marketing Important In The Travel Industry?**

Email marketing is an effective tool to keep customers engaged throughout the
booking process. Here are the key benefits that make email marketing important
for travel businesses:

### **1\. Inexpensive, Quick, And Simple To Set Up**

Email marketing is an **inexpensive** yet effective way of reaching out to
potential customers. Setting up campaigns requires minimal effort and time,
with **no delivery costs** for emails sent out.

With the right email list, you can start engaging with your target audience at
a fraction of the cost compared to other digital marketing channels. Moreover,
a powerful email marketing campaign can be set up in a matter of days or even
hours if you have the resources, such as an email template, ready to go.

All this translates to higher ROI and faster results.

### **2\. Increases Brand Loyalty And Awareness**

Travel emails are a great way to build trust and loyalty. When sent with the
right frequency and content, they make customers feel special about your
brand.

With every email, you can reinforce your brand values and educate customers
about the features of a product or service. For instance, you can inform
people about the importance of pre-booking or discuss local attractions and
activities in the area they are visiting.

By sharing regular content that genuinely helps readers, you can instil a
sense of trust and confidence in your brand that your competitors may find
difficult to replicate.

Moreover, email marketing helps to keep customers informed and engaged
throughout their journey with you. This, in turn, leads to increased brand
awareness and recognition.

### **3\. A Customized Approach**

Using email personalization and segmentation techniques, you can deliver
customized emails that offer relevant offers or discounts to customers who
have already shown an interest in your products.

This puts you in a better position to drive conversions and improve sales.

You can also send surveys and feedback requests to customers. This helps in
understanding customer preferences and developing better strategies for the
future.

**For example,** a survey can help you understand the kind of content your
customers are interested in or what type of discounts they prefer. This
ensures that your travel emails are always tailored to their actual needs and
wants.

### **4\. Email And Social Media Integrated Together**

Integrating email and social media is a great way to increase your reach.
Social media channels are perfect for engaging with customers and building
relationships, but email is the best channel for conversion.

**For example** , you can use social media to share updates about new
destinations or discounts and then direct users to a landing page that
captures their email addresses. This ensures that your conversion funnel is
optimized and you have a steady stream of warm leads.

### **5\. Reaching The Correct Segment**

Segmenting your email list is one thing. But targeting the right segment is
another. Email marketing for tourism can help you stand out in a sea of
competitors by quickly A/B testing differing segments and optimizing for the
correct target audience.

This helps you to quickly identify the right messaging and audience
segmentation, which will increase conversions. Additionally, you can use email
segmentation techniques to assess customer behaviour and send out more
personalized messages that add value to their experience.

## **12 Actionable Tips For Travel Email Marketing**

Email marketing can be an effective tool for your travel business with the
right approach. Here are 12 actionable tips for travel email marketing to help
you get started:

### **1\. Nail Your Welcome Emails**

Making a good first impression is crucial. And in the ruthless world of
digital competition, you might not get a second chance to do so. Customers
must receive a welcome email when they sign up or subscribe to your travel
list or platform.

Welcome emails are reported to have an open rate of 91.43%. They can include
videos, exclusive deals, a sign-up form, or simply a kind greeting to begin
the client relationship on the right note. An eye-catching visual, along with
compelling content, is all that makes the difference and sets the tone for
further communication.

You can make your welcome email more appealing by:

  * Presenting your core values
  * Providing a special discount offer
  * Including a video tour of popular travel destinations

### **2\. Segment Your Demography**

Customers with similar traits can be grouped together via segmentation. For
example, you may segment your email list based on client interest, location,
purchase history, customer type, and other factors.

To get more demographic segmentation options, gather more information from the
audience throughout the sign-up process. However, be cautious with this
because soliciting too much information may deter individuals from signing up
at all.

By doing this, you can easily configure your campaigns and guarantee that each
message is relevant to every reader. Engagement will increase when you send
emails that speak to the subscriber’s specific travel needs and wants. After
all, studies suggest that segmented email marketing generates a click-through
rate that is 90.7% greater than non-segmented efforts.

### **3\. Automate Emails for Fast Response Times**

When time is of the essence in travel, automated emails can help you respond
quickly and accurately to customer inquiries.

For instance, when a customer books a ticket, you can send an automated email
to confirm their booking. You can also automate emails for customer feedback
surveys, promotional offers and discounts, loyalty points reminders, and more.
These are not only time-saving but also cost-effective.

**Another Example of Automated Emails** is travel emails during the holiday
season. It’s the textbook definition of doing the right thing at the right
time. Readers are in the holiday mood and ready to travel around with their
loved ones.

So automating the delivery of holiday-centric email designs, giving them
special packages or limited-time offers, or telling them which destination is
ideal for visiting based on past purchases can go a long way to boost
engagement.

### **4\. Be Generous With Travel Ideas**

Providing consumers with authentic information about possible travel
destinations will engage them and build curiosity. You can include ‘Did You
Know Facts’ about a particular city in your email campaigns, along with videos
and pictures.

This will increase the chances of the customer getting back to inquire
further. Travel ideas could include:

  * City guides
  * Tips on different types of travel
  * Top places to eat listicles
  * Things to do per month
  * Hotels nearby

### **5\. Create and Market A Loyalty Program**

A customer loyalty programme is a promotional tool that acknowledges and
compensates customers that engage with or make repeat purchases. Under this,
your business may award points or benefits that give out badges and promotes
them to greater levels of loyalty.

Giving your customers an incentive beyond your products or services is a great
tactic to make them return for more. Repeat customers are more profitable as
they spend 67% more than first-time customers. Free goodies, prizes, coupons,
or special privileges like first access to new products are examples of
benefits that could lure customers in.

### **6\. Inspire Urgency with Limited Time Deals**

Create a sense of urgency by using scarcity to persuade customers to take
action now. Inform them that your offer is only valid for a short period and
that you are doing something unique for them by providing a discount.

The tight deadline should be such that it encourages subscribers to act fast.
Include the time and date the offer expires. To make it look even more
creative, add an email countdown timer to the bottom of the email to remind
them to hurry up before time runs out.

### **7\. Capture and Share Testimonials**

Consumers claim that online reviews influence their purchasing decisions 93%
of the time. Create and send marketing emails that include endorsements from
satisfied customers. These could take the shape of videos, reels, images, or
reviews in writing.

Furthermore, you can also share a customer’s experience while they are on the
trip with you. Encourage them to post about their experiences on social media
and share them with a custom hashtag that uniquely signifies your brand. For
example, if you’re a tour operator, create a hashtag like ‘travellingwithXYZ’,
where XYZ is your brand’s name.

This will create a sense of community and bring them closer to your brand.
People are more likely to trust your services if they see social proof of
satisfied customers. By doing this, you build your readers’ trust in your
brand, making them opt for your holiday package over your competitors.

### **8\. Include Videos to Showcase Travel Experiences**

60% of travellers who watch videos on social media use them to guide their
decisions, whether they pick a tour operator to book with or a destination to
visit.

As a travel and tourism brand, you can leverage videos that tell stories about
positive customer experiences to win over your audience and ultimately
generate leads.

Focus on the story you are conveying. By creating a captivating narrative, you
will be able to engage viewers on an emotional level. The more engaging your
story is, the more likely your viewers will take action.

You can find free and affordable stock videos that you can use to showcase the
beauty of a destination or life on board a cruise. Alternatively, you can
create your own videos and add them to your email.

Whatever the case, remember that timing is everything. According to research,
you generally have7 seconds to create an impression on a customer before their
attention is diverted, and you risk losing them. Hence, strive to create short
videos that are captivating enough to keep the viewer engaged until the CTA.

If you already have a long video ready to go, consider breaking it into
smaller, more attention-grabbing chunks of content.

### **9\. A/B Test Your Subject Lines**

A/B testing allows you to assess how version A of something – for example,
your email subject line – performs compared to version B. This test helps you
to identify which version of the subject line will get a higher open rate.
Through this, you can determine what works best for your target audience.

Up to 50% of your chosen contacts will receive an email with the subject line
A, while an equal number will receive an email with the subject line B.

The email subject line that has received the most opens after a predefined
period of time is deemed the winner. The remaining contacts who weren’t
included in the A/B test population are automatically emailed the winning
subject line.

A/B testing is an effective tool that removes ambiguity from what will
intrigue customers and gives tangible data to back up your decisions.

### **10\. Always Opt for Mobile-friendly Email Designs**

A mobile-friendly approach to email design ensures an adequate user experience
on small screens. This prevents the user from zooming in and out to view
content. They also make it easy to navigate emails from a mobile phone.

Optimizing emails for smartphones requires the same consideration as designing
a mobile-responsive website and booking process, which you have likely already
been working on.

Given that nearly two-thirds of travel customers use their smartphones in
every part of their journey, including the booking process, you can no longer
ignore the importance of mobile-friendly emails.

To do this, you can:

  * Include a single-column layout with images,
  * Use buttons and CTAs that are large enough to click on without needing to zoom in
  * Ensure the loading time of emails is less than 2 seconds.

When designing emails, it is also essential to consider the end-users’ devices
and operating systems. You can use an email marketing platform to test emails
on different devices and browsers before sending out the final version.

### **11\. Offer Customized Deals (based on browsing data and preferences)**

There is no denying that customized deals improve customer engagement and
boost sales. They show customers that you are paying attention to their needs
and appreciate that they have chosen your brand for their travel needs.

You can begin by collecting information about their interests and browsing
history to offer customised deals. For instance, if you collect data about
customers’ browsing habits, you will know what type of holidays they would be
interested in and offer deals tailored to their needs.

You can also customize your deals with customer preference data from previous
bookings. For instance, if customers book a certain type of accommodation or
destination on multiple occasions, you can offer them special discounts for
their next booking.

### **12\. Leverage A Winning Email Design Philosophy**

Your email design should be clean and professional, with images that grab
attention. The layout should remain consistent to ensure familiarity. Remember
that consistency builds trust and makes your emails more recognizable.

Use visuals to increase engagement, such as high-quality images highlighting a
destination’s or hotel’s features. Also, keep an eye on the text-image ratio
to ensure that emails are easy to read.

Finally, make sure your calls-to-action (CTAs) are clear and concise. It is
essential to make the most of your limited space using effective CTAs, so
customers know what to do.

By leveraging a winning email design philosophy, you can ensure that customers
retain their interest in your emails and move through the conversion funnel of
your booking process.

## **Types of Emails You Can Use for Travel Marketing**

### **1\. The Warm Welcome**

Welcome emails have the highest delivery, open, and click-through rates. Your
welcome email should thank your audience for associating themselves with your
brand.

It must be warm, inviting, and informative. As soon as subscribers sign up,
send them a welcome email to let them know who you are, the brand’s mission
and what to expect from your business.

It is a part of onboarding emails that help users get acquainted with the
brand. In return, this will help the audience build trust in the organization.

They can also be set up to be automatically triggered. So when someone signs
up, they get a welcome email right away.

Engagement statistics degrade when they are not automated. Automated welcome
emails may have an open rate of more than 85% and a click-through rate of 29%.
Open rates fall to 52% when delivered manually, while click-through rates fall
to 12%.

A double opt-in, an introduction to your company, and a reminder to set their
email preferences can all be included in a welcome email.

### **2\. The Newsletter**

Informational newsletters work best. They are not salesy and don’t push
products and services beyond what subscribers would want.

90/10 is one suggested formula for newsletters: 90% information and 10%
advertising. Less is more in the appropriate proportions, and instructional
content will typically generate more engagement than product copy.

The newsletter is a flexible format that may be used to:

  * Offer news about the travel industry
  * Introduce a new benefit or service
  * Announce your most recent packages and tour options
  * And give travellers suggestions for weekend getaways.

Here are 24 Newsletter Ideas to keep your audience engaged and generate
revenue.

### **3\. The Seasonal or Milestone Offer**

Use a seasonal offer to remind people why they should be travelling. Seasonal
offers, such as holiday packages and summer discounts, could help customers
get in the mood to travel.

You can also use milestone offers to bring customers back. For example, if
someone hasn’t been on holiday for a while, you could email them a special
deal to entice them to book a future trip.

Promotions centred around holidays such as Valentine’s Day, Mother’s Day, or
even long weekends are not uncommon. Campaigns for Diwali/ Christmas break and
summer vacations are also popular. These campaigns should always focus on the
customer’s interests first, as they will appreciate a chance to save money on
their adventures.

Although conversions are the apparent objective, the goal should be to develop
customer relationships. Marketers should put the customer first and build
trust between them and their brand by communicating sincerely, offering
discounts, and providing valuable information.

### **4\. The Booking Confirmation**

A booking confirmation email simply confirms a customer’s action. When a
traveller purchases your travel package or makes a booking through you, they
should receive a confirmation email.

These emails help affirm the customer’s purchase and provide helpful
information like check-in times, hotel locations, and other information they
should know. This can develop a trusting experience by establishing a
relationship and encouraging confidence from the minute they book.

Setting up automated booking confirmation emails means guests will have all
the required information at their fingertips. Also, passengers frequently
examine these travel agency emails more than once; they have almost
unrealistically high open rates.

With those open rates, pursuing more conversion and income opportunities is
worthwhile. Consider cross-selling or upselling other travel packages or
services or including a list of your most travelled destinations at the end of
such emails.

### **5\. The Informational Message**

More than 75% of customers believe that educational content influences
decision-making. The objective here is to present yourself as a caring and
supporting brand to your current and prospective clients.

You can forewarn travellers about adverse weather, tourist attractions, or
scheduled events before they arrive. You could also help them with booking,
packing, and other details of their trip. Other topics for informational
emails can include safety tips, travel advice, and culinary recommendations.

The content should constantly be engaging while serving a purpose. It should
not be promotional but rather informative. You should focus on what the
traveller wants to know and develop content beyond what subscribers would
expect.

These emails should also be sent regularly, as customers tend to forget about
the offers, discounts, and services. You can also re-engage your customers
with ideas for their next trip through these messages.

### **6\. The Thank You Email**

Beyond mere thankfulness, expressing gratitude will foster stronger customer
relations. Clients abandon a brand in roughly 68% of cases because they feel
the company doesn’t care about them. Thank You emails can increase loyalty and
dissuade them from searching elsewhere.

Additionally, a 2% increase in client retention might have the same effect as
a 10% cut in costs.

Thanking a customer gives you a reason to interact with those who haven’t been
around in a while, allowing you to continue the dialogue with those who only
frequently or seasonally make purchases. Maintaining these dialogues will also
enable you to establish your brand’s personality, something customers will
value.

A Thank You email should be personalized and direct, with genuine content that
doesn’t sound fake or robotic. It is also essential to consider the kind of
journey a customer had and strive to make them feel appreciated for their
business.

Along with the thank you note, consider providing beneficial recommendations
for a product or service. It could be a list of the top sights in the city for
which they recently made travel arrangements.

Maybe it’s a special eBook on how to extend the life and uptime of the travel
gear they just bought. Ensure the information is genuine, helpful, and
valuable to the reader. Alternatively, consider including a link to a survey
to collect feedback that you can use to improve the services your brand
offers.

### **7\. The Loyalty or Referral Program Email**

Frequent travellers will appreciate being a part of an up-to-date loyalty
program. You can design the scheme to be point-based or just offer flat
discounts on specific services. Rewards for attaining milestones and birthday
surprises are other excellent features. A referral program driven by your
loyalty program may also assist you in expanding your email list and
increasing your conversion rate.

This type of email aims to entice the customer with offers and exclusive
deals. They should feel like they are being rewarded for their loyalty and
that you value their patronage. Not only will this help build relationships
that last over time, but it can also encourage customers to recommend your
services to their friends and family.

### **8\. Notifications and Updates**

Compared to advertising emails or newsletters, email notifications get greater
attention since they include information that a user has asked for. They can
include tailored offers and timely reminders about upcoming events or service
changes.

Owing to the high open rate, the server’s reputation is enhanced, and future
email deliverability is improved. Sharing updates will also help to reduce any
potential adverse effects of the downsides of travelling, like flight delays
or lost baggage, by providing the customer with information regarding their
itinerary.

### **9\. Drip-fed Promotional Campaigns**

An Email drip campaign is a series of automatic emails sent to website
visitors after they perform a particular activity or activate a behavior-based
trigger. You can decide how many emails and at what rate to send them for any
particular activity. These emails can be personalized by including information
about the contact, such as their name and their actions.

**Example:** You can set up abandoned cart emails for customers who add an
item to their online basket but do not complete the transaction. You may also
set up an email series to remind customers of offers they may have missed.

**Example:** You can also set browse abandonment emails for visitors who
browse your products / services but dont make a purchase.

**Example:** You can also set an upsell email series for clients who have
bought a certain product / service.

### **10\. Survey Emails**

Survey emails are a great way to collect customer feedback and gain insight
into their needs. This will enable you to make focused improvements while
measuring current customer satisfaction levels.

By understanding how satisfied customers are with your services and their
experiences when using them, you can come up with ways to improve. For
example, if many customers are dissatisfied with baggage handling or a lack of
Wi-Fi in their hotels, you can begin to look for ways to rectify the issue.

Additionally, customers are more likely to be responsive if their feedback is
valued. Sending out survey emails at regular intervals will help you stay on
top of the data, enabling you to make quick adjustments and increase customer
satisfaction.

Here are some handy tips to follow:

  * Survey emails should be well-crafted with clear objectives, incentives for participation, and simple language that is easy to understand.
  * When including questions, try to keep them as objective and specific as possible.
  * Asking open-ended questions can lead to more insightful answers and require more time to analyze.
  * You should also consider the order of the questions and ensure they are relevant to each other. This will help keep participants engaged until the end of the survey.

## **Email Marketing And The Importance Of Automation**

Email marketing and automation are essential in any travel business. They help
businesses keep in touch with customers, send personalized messages, and even
nurture leads. With the right tools and software, businesses can create
workflows to automate mundane tasks such as email list management, lead
segmentation, content delivery, and more.

Email Automation also helps ensure that emails are sent to the right people at
the right time. By understanding customer behaviors and preferences,
businesses can deliver timely emails with engaging content that will convert.

Here are some actionable tips to help you automate your email marketing
efforts with ease:

  * Create personalized emails for each customer segment on your list.
  * Utilize automation to trigger relevant emails in the customers’ journey at the right time.
  * Leverage user data to create dynamic content based on each user’s preferences.
  * Use A/B testing to test different email campaigns and optimize for maximum results.
  * Analyze customer behavior to identify powerful marketing opportunities and create better campaigns.
  * Incorporate automated surveys into your emails for improved feedback collection.
  * Automatically respond to customer queries in real-time using AI chatbots.
  * Monitor emails for deliverability and conduct regular cleanups of invalid or duplicate contacts to ensure optimal performance.

By leveraging the power of email marketing and automation, businesses can
improve their customer relationships, increase sales, reduce costs, and ensure
no valuable opportunity is missed. Making the most out of automation tools and
techniques can help travel businesses create effective email campaigns that
drive positive results.

## **Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)**

### **Q1. How To Create Catchy Travel Emails?**

Creating catchy travel emails can be done by following some simple steps:

  * Craft an enticing subject line that stands out from the crowd and is short and snappy.
  * Personalize your emails by including the customer’s name and other details.
  * Use visuals such as pictures or videos to capture the reader’s attention.
  * Keep content short and to-the-point, focusing on one key message at a time.
  * Include a call-to-action to encourage readers to take the desired action.
  * Use A/B testing to test different email elements and optimize them for maximum results.
  * Segment your audience according to their interests and needs and send them relevant messages.

### **Q2. How Beneficial Are Emails For Travel Businesses?**

Emails are a powerful tool for travel businesses, as they can help to reach a
wide audience quickly at a minimal cost. They provide an easy way to engage
customers, drive sales, and build relationships. Emails are also an excellent
way to collect customer data which can be used for market research and
targeted campaigns. As such, emails are an invaluable tool for travel
businesses looking to maximize their digital success.
